item.name: POV From Multigrade To Multitouch

block1.item: İstanbul Bilgi University, Photography and Video Department, Visual Communication Design Department

item.block2: This book is published on the occasion of photography exhibition “From Multigrade to Multitouch” held at Photokina, Köln between September 21-28, 2008, consisting of the works of Istanbul Bilgi University’s Photography and Video and Visual Communication Design students.

item.name: Photokina Post-Card Set
item.block2: This post-card set consisting of 15 cards, consists of a selection of student works of İstanbul Bilgi University Photography and Video and the Visual Communication Design Departments shown at “From Multigrade to Multitouch” exhibition held at Photokina Fair, Köln between 21 September - 28 September 2008.

Track 07 First Edition, Plexi glass cover

item.block2: This book is published on the occasion of Track 07 exhibition presenting a wide selection of student works produced during 2007 by the students of VCD and POV departments at İstanbul Bilgi University. Track 07 exhibition has been organized at santralistanbul, under the visual concept “Taction”. This catalogue has an attachment of 2 DVD’s including the works exhibited at Track 07 exhibition.<br> Articles included in this catalogue are consecutively: Track 07 Exhibition; Taction; The Aura of the Digital; Policies of Speed in the Metaphorical Space: The Cyber-Utopias of Our Time

block3.item: Prof. Dr. İhsan Derman, Dr.Michael Betancourt, Ahmet Atıf Akın, Aslı Telli Aydemir

item.name: Track 07 DVD Box
item.block2:
This DVD set is comprised of 2 DVD’s containing a selection of students works produced by students of İstanbul Bilgi University VCD and POV departments, exhibited during the Track 07.

DVD 1 includes graphic design works, photography works.
DVD 2 includes video projects and interactive designs.

block3.item: DVD and Graphic Design: Istanbul Bilgi University Visual Communication Design Students (2008)

item.name: Track 07 Second Edition
item.block2: This book is published on the occasion of the Track 07 exhibition presenting a wide selection of student works produced during 2007 by the students of VCD and POV departments at İstanbul Bilgi University. Track 07 exhibition has been organized at santralistanbul, under the visual concept “Taction”. Articles included in the catalogue are: Track 07 Exhibition; Taction; The Aura of the Digital

block3.item: Prof. Dr. İhsan Derman, Dr.Michael Betancourt, Ahmet Atıf Akın, Aslı Telli Aydemir

item.name: Track 06

block1.item: İstanbul Bilgi University, Visual Communication Design Department

item.block2: Accompanying Track 06, this exhibition catalogue is planned to serve as a platform formed both through the contributions of students and instructors to the discussions on multi-media and technical images and through the prints of nearly 40 students’ works selected for Track 06. Track 06 Exhibition has been organized at Istanbul, Tütün Deposu, under the visual concept 'Implant'.<br> Articles included in this catalogue are consecutively:Track 06 Exhibition; You are What You…; The Photography as A Form of Contemporary Theory: Making the World a Little More Enigmatic and Unintelligible; Medium is The Flesh; Space Invaders: About the Dissolution of Space in Contemporary Visual Arts.

block3.item: Prof. Dr. İhsan Derman, Orhan Cem Çetin, Dr.Gerry Coulter, Ahmet Atıf Akın, Marcus Graf

item.name: Track 06 DVD Set
item.block2:
This DVD set is comprised of 2 DVD’s containing a selection of students works produced by students of İstanbul Bilgi University VCD and POV departments, exhibited during the Track 06.

DVD 1 includes graphic design works, photography works.
DVD 2 includes video projects and interactive designs.

block3.item: Istanbul Bilgi University Visual Communication Design Students (2007)

item.name: Social Life at Santral
item.block2: This is a documentary movie about the workers of Silahtarağa Electric Plant and the residents of santral quarters. Based on the interviews and original photographs, this movie shares the memories and the stories of the people who worked and lived in this unusual settlement.

block3.item: Warehouse supervisor Hayati Alpay and His Wife Meliha Alpay, Santral’s last manager Özdemir Çırpan, Kaya Ercanlı, Engineer wife Şirin Sarıca, Santral’s Doctor’s Sons Ferhan and Orhan Topçuoğlu and Worker Şükrü Yalazay
Burak Beceren, İlkay Can Saray, Mustafa Ercan Zırh

item.name: Showreel
item.block2: This DVD contains a showreel of the selected works produced between the years of 1997-2005 by the students of İstanbul Bilgi University VCD department, including graphic design works, photography works, interactive projects, video projects.

block3.item: Istanbul Bilgi University Visual Communication Design Students (2006)

item.name: Relocate RetroTracks

block1.item: İstanbul Bilgi University, Visual Communication Design Department

item.block2:
This book is the catalogue of the ‘Relocate RetroTracks’ exhibition organized in the scope of Ars Electronica 2005 at Linz, Austria, a compilation of the selected works from 4 previous annual ‘Track’ exhibitions held in İstanbul.
Articles included in the catalogue are: Relocate: RetroTracks; Traversing Figures of the Electronic; Internet; The Evolving Design and Interaction.

block3.item: Prof. Dr. İhsan Derman, Lewis Keir Johnson, Ali Pekşen, Mahir M. Yavuz

item.name: Music Map

block1.item: İstanbul Bilgi University, Visual Communication Design Department

item.block2: This concise reference book constitutes a model work for graduation projects in the Visual Communication Design Department. Through a sample graduation project entitled 'Music Map' by Fahri Özkaramanlı, the book shows all the phases of the project from idea to execution, with an evaluation of each project meeting all the way to the final product.

item.name: İstanbul: City of Memories and Hopes

image.cap: İstanbul: City of Memories and Hopes

item.block2:
This collection is not a complete album, but rather an impression of modern İstanbul with a historic backdrop. It reflects the city through scenes of the streets and its inhabitants.
In this album, the reader will come across two different faces of the city; one, a romantic landscape with palaces, mosques, churches, synagogues and "yalıs", beautiful houses along the sparkling Bosphorus, the other, a lively metropolis of over 12 million - which at times camouflages this romantic landscape with impressive skyscrapers and busy traffic.

block3.item: Zümrüt Alp, Zeynep Avcı, Susanne Fawler, Ayça İnce

İldem Akçakaya, Alper Akçay, Yasin Baran, Bertan Başaran, İhsan Derman, Aylin Dinçer, Onur Eroğlu, Engin Gerçek, Fırat Giraylıgil (giraygil olacak galiba), Alişan Özkan, Burak Pekakcan, Ali Pekşen, Ebru Sile
Promat Basim Yayin Sanayi ve Ticaret A.Ş

item.name: Beyoğlu: A City Where Cultures Meet

image.cap: Beyoğlu: A City Where Cultures Meet

block1.item: Istanbul Bilgi University, Visual Communication Design Department

item.block2: A book portraying the district of Beyoğlu with images and words, focusing on the cultural diversity, exploring the history and daily life around homes and streets, food markets, restaurants, festivals, travellers, local people, street sellers, religious places and schools. While most books on Beyoğlu depict its past, this one aims to record the present, Beyoğlu of the 2000s.

block3.item: Yasin Baran, Engin Gerçek, Ali Peksen
Promat Basim Yayin Sanayi ve Ticaret A.S
